baseExo module¶

baseExo.addClearPage()[source]¶

This function adds a clear page command in LaTeX.

baseExo.coeffPoly3Deg(genCode='9999999999')[source]¶

This Python function generates coefficients for a third-degree polynomial, plots the polynomial, and saves the plot as an image file.

Parameters:

genCode – The genCode parameter is a string that represents a generated code used for naming

the output file. In the provided function coeffPoly3Deg, this code is used to save a plot as a PNG file with a specific name, defaults to 9999999999 (optional) :return: The function coeffPoly3Deg returns a list containing the coefficients of a third-degree polynomial equation, the constant term, and the file path where the plot of the polynomial function is saved. The list has the following structure: [aa, bb, cc, dd, filepath].

baseExo.exoVecteurAffine2nd(id=False)[source]¶
baseExo.exoVecteurN0(id=False)[source]¶

This function generates a LaTeX exercise and its correction for placing points and representing vectors in an orthonormal coordinate system. :param id: The id parameter is a boolean flag that determines whether to include an identification string in the generated LaTeX code. If id is set to True, the identification string exoVecteurN0` will be included at the beginning of the exercise and correction sections. If `id is set to False, no identification string will be included. This parameter allows for optional identification of the exercise in the generated LaTeX document. :return: The function exoVecteurN0 returns two strings: exo and correction. Both strings contain LaTeX code for an exercise and its corresponding correction, respectively. The exercise involves placing points and representing vectors in an orthonormal coordinate system, while the correction provides the same information for reference.

baseExo.exoVecteurN1(genCode='999999999', id=False)[source]¶

This function generates a LaTeX exercise and its correction for placing points and calculating vector coordinates and norms in an orthonormal coordinate system. :param genCode: The genCode parameter is a string that represents a unique identifier or code for the generated exercise. It is used to differentiate between different versions of the exercise, allowing for easy tracking and organization. This code can be useful for educators or students who want to reference a specific version of the exercise.

:param id: The id parameter is a boolean flag that determines whether to include an identification string in the generated LaTeX code. If id is set to True, the identification string exoVecteurN1` will be included at the beginning of the exercise and correction sections. If `id is set to False, no identification string will be included. This parameter allows for optional identification of the exercise in the generated LaTeX document. :return: The function exoVecteurN1 returns two strings: exo and correction. Both strings contain LaTeX code for an exercise and its corresponding correction, respectively. The exercise involves placing points and calculating vector coordinates and norms in an orthonormal coordinate system, while the correction provides the same information for reference.
